title: 'Holy s*** look at this stuff': This was the reaction to the Nixon tapes
description: In 1974, former President Nixon released the transcripts from the now-infamous tapes of his conversations in the White House. "Watergate: Blueprint for a Scandal" looks back at how this pivotal decision forever changed politics. The series airs Sunday at 9 p.m. and 10 p.m. ET/PT.

title: Armed man arrested and charged with attempted murder of Justice Brett Kavanaugh
description: An armed man was arrested near Brett Kavanaugh's Maryland home after making threats against the Supreme Court justice, according to a court spokesperson.

title: From 'pariah' to 'partner'? CNN anchor presses White House official on Saudi Arabia
description: President Joe Biden and Saudi Arabia's de facto ruler, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, could meet for the first time after months of diplomatic heavy lifting. This meeting could represent a turnabout for a US president who once declared Saudi Arabia a "pariah."

title: 'Predator' prequel 'Prey' pulls audiences back to the Comanche tribe 300 years ago
description: 20th Century Studios and Hulu dropped the first full trailer for its "Predator" prequel, "Prey." The movie will be the first ever dubbed and subtitled in Comanche language, with a cast almost fully comprised of Native and First Nation talent.

title: OECD secretary-general: Global cost of Russian oil embargo
description: Mathias Cormann, Secretary-General of the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development, speaks with CNN's Julia Chatterley about the group's latest report that projects the economic effects of Russia's invasion of Ukraine and high inflation.

title: 11-year-old who was inside classroom with shooter speaks out on camera
description: Miah Cerrillo, a survivor of the Uvalde shooting, and her father Miguel Cerrillo testify at the House Oversight Committee's hearing on gun violence.

title: Chinese hackers breach 'major' telecoms firms, US says
description: Chinese government-backed hackers have breached "major telecommunications companies," among a range of targets worldwide, by exploiting known software flaws in routers and other popular network networking gear, US security agencies warned Tuesday.

title: EU's centerpiece climate legislation rejected
description: Lawmakers from the European parliament on Wednesday rejected several key pieces of climate legislation for slashing greenhouse gas emissions after conservative factions tried to have them watered down.

title: Tom Brady underwear video has the internet buzzing
description: Tom Brady's wife posts video of Tom in his boxer briefs. CNN's Jeanne Moos says forget the offensive line, he's selling his own underwear line.

title: One person dead, five with life-threatening injuries after car driven into crowd in Berlin
description: One person is dead and at least 30 are injured after a vehicle drove into a crowd near a church in Berlin, Germany, authorities say.

title: Olympic gymnasts Biles, Raisman and Maroney are among dozens seeking $1 billion from the FBI over botched Larry Nassar sex abuse investigation
description: Attorneys for more than 90 women and girls who were sexually abused by disgraced former USA Gymnastics team doctor Larry Nassar submitted claims for over $1 billion to the FBI, saying investigators could have ended Nassar's predation and protected other victims had they not mishandled the case.

title: Nike is shutting down its Run Club app in China
description: Nike is deactivating its Run Club app in China, becoming the latest Western company to reconfigure its business in the world's second largest economy.

title: China's BYD will supply EV batteries to 'good friend' Elon Musk 'very soon'
description: BYD, the Warren Buffett-backed Chinese electric carmaker, plans to supply batteries to Tesla "very soon," a senior executive from the company told a Chinese state-owned broadcaster.

title: Looking for a job? Watch out for these scams
description: The strong labor market has given us near record low unemployment, higher wages -- and an unfortunate uptick in the number of reports of job seekers getting scammed.

title: Moderna says updated Covid-19 vaccine booster shows stronger antibody response against Omicron
description: Moderna said on Wednesday its bivalent Covid-19 vaccine booster that contained a vaccine targeting the Omicron variant showed a stronger immune response against the variant.

title: Iranian passenger train derails, killing at least 17
description: At least 17 people were killed and 50 more injured after a passenger train derailed in eastern Iran early Wednesday morning, the Iranian Red Crescent said on Twitter.

title: Matthew McConaughey makes emotional plea for gun control at White House
description: Actor Matthew McConaughey delivered impassioned and at-times emotional remarks at the White House press briefing on Tuesday, telling the stories of those who died in the elementary school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, and urging more action on gun control.

title: US has 'very serious' problem with Covid-19 vaccine uptake
description: The United States has a "very serious" problem with Covid-19 vaccination uptake, a top health official has warned.

title: Video shows scene in Berlin where car drove into crowd
description: At least one person is dead after a car drove into crowd near the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church in western Berlin, according to the Berlin Fire Brigade. CNN's Nada Bashir reports.

title: Stunning moment as Ukrainian forces bring CNN to secret location to attack Russian position
description: As Russia remains focused on the battle in eastern Ukraine, Ukrainian forces are pushing back by reclaiming territories in the south. CNN's Matthew Chance is on the front lines with an exclusive look into this battle.

title: Jim Seals, of soft-rock duo Seals and Crofts, dead at 80
description: Jim Seals, one half of 1970s soft-rock duo Seals and Croft, has died at the age of 80, according to his family.

title: Which Jurassic Park film has roared loudest at the ticket booth?
description: "Jurassic World: Dominion," the latest film in the Jurassic Park franchise, stomps into theaters this weekend. The sixth film in the dinosaurs-run-amok series could be one of the biggest of the summer — if not the entire year.

title: UN-mandated rights inquiry rebukes Israel for seeking 'complete control'
description: An independent commission of inquiry set up by the UN Human Rights Council after the 2021 Gaza war said Israel must do more than end the occupation of land Palestinians want for a state, according to a report released on Tuesday.

title: Denver Broncos and Walton-Penner family enter into purchase and sale agreement
description: The Denver Broncos and the Walton-Penner family have entered into a purchase and sale agreement to acquire the NFL team, it was announced on Tuesday.

title: Student who survived Uvalde shooting and others testify on gun violence at House hearing on Wednesday
description: A House committee will hear testimony on gun violence at a hearing on Wednesday, including from a fourth-grade student who survived the horrific mass shooting last month at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, that shocked the nation.

title: 'The stork is on the way' -- Nick Cannon confirms he's having more children this year
description: Nick Cannon says he is preparing to welcome yet more children this year.

title: The man who bought an entire village in Italy
description: Italy has in recent years sold off hundreds of dilapidated homes for next to nothing, thanks to schemes to attract new residents triggering a wave of regeneration for rural communities.

title: Suspected 'Pillowcase Rapist' is charged in a series of sexual assaults in Florida in the 1980s
description: Aided by advances in DNA technology, authorities in Florida say they have identified and charged the so-called Pillowcase Rapist accused of sexually assaulting multiple women in the 1980s.

title: Emma Raducanu has 'no idea' whether she'll compete at Wimbledon after 'freak' injury
description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu says she's unsure whether she'll be fit enough to compete at this year's Wimbledon after suffering a "freak" injury at a WTA 250 event in Nottingham, England, on Tuesday.

title: Inspired by sacred music, an artist's 'Black Chapel' is opening in London
description: A striking meditative temple made of painted black wood has been built in London's Hyde Park as part of a prestigious annual architecture commission.

title: China offers $15,000 cash — or a 'spiritual reward' — for national security tip-offs
description: China is offering its citizens cash rewards of up to and above 100,000 yuan ($15,000) for tip-offs about people who endanger national security, as authorities intensify a years-long campaign to weed out what they see as growing threats from foreign espionage and "hostile forces."

title: Prescription cannabis products with more THC may ease chronic pain, study finds
description: People who suffer from chronic pain may find small-to-moderate pain relief for the short-term when using certain prescription cannabis products with higher THC to CBD levels, but there are some worrisome side effects, according to new research.

title: Credit Suisse warns of yet another loss
description: Credit Suisse warned on Wednesday of a likely group-wide second-quarter loss as volatility hits its investment bank, extending a losing streak stretching back to 2021.

title: The South African company building beloved American supercars
description: What do a World War Two Lancaster bomber airplane, a Massey Ferguson tractor and a Volkswagen Beetle have in common? Believe it or not, their parts have ended up in some of the most iconic race cars of all time.

title: 6 takeaways from Tuesday's primaries
description: Rising concerns about crime and homelessness burst to the forefront Tuesday as San Francisco voters recalled District Attorney Chesa Boudin, a progressive who had ended cash bail and sought to reduce the number of people sent to prison.

title: 'My body my f****** choice': Abortion rights activists strip down in megachurch
description: An abortion rights activist stripped down to her underwear and yelled, "My body, my f***ing choice" in Joel Osteen's church.

title: The world's most expensive cities for 2022
description: Global mobility company ECA International has released its annual list of the world's most expensive cities to live in, and once again Hong Kong has landed at the top of the list.

title: A 10-year-old girl was arrested after police say she fatally shot a woman arguing with her mom
description: A 10-year-old girl was arrested Tuesday after authorities say she fatally shot a woman who was arguing with her mother, according to the Orlando Police Department.

title: Search continues for pair missing in Amazon area known for illegal mining and drug trafficking routes
description: The families of a British journalist and a Brazilian indigenous affairs expert are calling on Brazilian authorities to intensify their search efforts for the pair, who went missing in a remote part of the Brazilian Amazon this weekend.

title: American gun owners explain their love of AR-15 style rifles
description: While AR-15 style rifles have a political and symbolic value for some gun owners, others say they are simply enjoyable to own. CNN's Randi Kaye goes behind the reasons why.
